description.en: The course will introduce students to the fundamentals of research ethics. This includes a brief overview of ethics as a theory and practice, and then a more focused investigation of research ethics, especially in the field of humanities and social sciences. The students will read and discuss various relevant guidelines and codes governing the field, study the relationship between good science and misconduct, discuss authorship practices within their own research disciplines, problems associated with conflicts of interest, and finally analyse the ethical aspects of their own research.
description.et: Kursus tutvustab tudengeile teaduseetika aluseid, mh juhatab sisse eetikasse, teaduseetikasse, ning keskendub kõige põhjalikumalt just teaduseetika küsimustele humanitaarias ja sotsiaalteadustes. Tudengid loevad ning arutlevad erinevate teadust reguleerivate tavade ning koodeksite üle, uurivad hea teaduse ning väärkäitumise teooriat ning praktikat, arutavad oma eriala autorsuse praktikaid ja huvide konflikti vältimise viise. Lõpetuseks analüüsitakse omaenda uurimistöö eetilisi aspekte.

objectives.en: The course aims to introduce the students to the fundamentals of research ethics in humanities and social sciences.
objectives.et: Kursuse eesmärgiks on tutvustada tudengitele teaduseetika aluseid, fookusega humanitaar- ja sotsiaalvaldkonna erialadel ning uurimistöödel.

learning_outcomes.en: By the end of the course the student will have acquired:
-	Familiarity with the principles of research ethics and ability to use regulatory guidelines and codes in their own research field.
learning_outcomes.et: -	Tunneb teaduseetika põhimõtteid ning oskab kasutada valdkonda reguleerivaid teaduseetika juhiseid ja koodekseid.

learning_outcomes.en: -	Knowledge of good science practices and ability to avoid misconduct.
learning_outcomes.et: -	Teab hea teaduse tavasid ning oskab väärkäitumist vältida.

learning_outcomes.en: -	Capacity to recognize and analyse critically the ethical aspects of their own research
learning_outcomes.et: -	Oskab ära tunda oma uurimistöö eetilisi aspekte ning neid kriitiliselt analüüsida.

learning_outcomes.en: -	Knowledge of what, if any, approvals may be needed to conduct research.
learning_outcomes.et: -	Teab, kas ja milliseid kooskõlastusi võib uurimistöö tegemiseks vaja olla.

learning_outcomes.en: -	Knowledge of the principles of authorship and how to avoid conflicts of interest in the research community.
learning_outcomes.et: -	Tunneb autorsuse põhimõtteid ning teab, kuidas teaduskogukonnas huvide konflikte vältida.

learning_outcomes.en: -	Practical experience in analyzing research ethics cases.
learning_outcomes.et: -	On omandanud praktilise kogemuse teaduseetika juhtumite analüüsimisel.

independent_work.et: The course consists of independent work and seminar-attendance. Independent work means reading through seminar materials prior to attending the seminar and fulfilling small homework tasks. Seminar attendance is compulsory and all absences will require extra homework to make up for. A written analysis of the ethical aspects of one's own research needs to be submitted.

description.et: * seminar attendance (max two missed seminars allowed that need to be compensated for)
* final analysis submitted (both draft and final version) and accepted

grade_preconditions.et: To graduate from the course, the homework needs to be done, seminars attended and final analysis delivered and accepted by the course instructor.

grade_evaluation.et:
For the final result the following components need to be accomplished and accepted by course instructor:
* seminar attendance (max two missed seminars allowed),
* small homeworks submitted on time,
* final analysis submitted and accepted.
